meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ecumenical.
meanings.sent1: The ecumenicity of the event brought together people from various backgrounds.
meanings.sent2: The ecumenicity of the church service welcomed all denominations.
meanings.sent3: The ecumenicity of the potluck dinner made for an interesting mix of dishes.
meanings.sent4: Her speech emphasized the ecumenicity of love, transcending all differences.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenicity of the choir's performance left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: The principle or aim of promoting unity among different Christian churches.
meanings.sent1: The ecumenicity of the council's decisions aimed to bring churches closer.
meanings.sent2: The ecumenicity of the mission trip fostered collaboration among Christian denominations.
meanings.sent3: The ecumenicity of the bake sale fundraiser united church members for a common cause.
meanings.sent4: The ecumenicity of the prayer circle symbolized harmony among Christian communities.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenicity of the joint service highlighted the strength of unity in diversity.
